Any numerical results quantifying estimated delay time and backup length on I-5 Southbound near Woodlands as a result of Lewis Bridge repairs begun July 15,2024. Please include any reports, memoranda or otherwise pertinent department documents summarizing the anticipated traffic delay times for southbound travelers as a result of this closure.

[ URL: https://wsdot.wa.gov/about/news/2024/two-month-southbound-i-5-around-clock-lane-closure-woodland-begins-july-15  ]. communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: COPA America Finals 🇦🇷 v. 🇨🇴
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I hereby request access to records and footage related to any incidents that occurred on July 14th, 2024 to July 15th 2024, at Hard Rock Stadium, located at 347 Don Shula Dr Suite 102, Miami Gardens, FL 33056. 

1. Body Camera Footage: All body camera footage from officers present at Hard Rock Stadium on July 14th, covering events leading up to the incident, interactions with individuals involved, and actions taken by officers during and after the incident.

2. Incident Reports: Comprehensive incident reports detailing the events at Hard Rock Stadium on July 14th, including charges filed, statements made by involved parties, and circumstances leading to the arrests.

3. Arrest Records: Records of all individuals arrested in connection with the incident, including specifics about the arrest, charges filed, and any statements made during the booking process.

4. Witness Statements: Any witness statements or reports from individuals who observed or were involved in the incident.

5. Dispatch Records: All dispatch call logs and recordings related to the incident.

6. Surveillance Footage: Any available surveillance footage from Hard Rock Stadium or nearby areas that captured the incident.

7. CCTV Evidence: CCTV footage from Hard Rock Stadium covering the incident.

8. Traffic Camera Footage: Any traffic camera footage from the surrounding area that captured the incident or related events.

9. Police Helicopter Footage: Any aerial footage from police helicopters during the incident.

10. Communication Records: Internal communications, including emails, text messages, and radio transmissions related to the incident.

11. Officer Notes: Any additional notes or reports made by officers involved in or responding to the incident.

12. Other Relevant Documentation: Any other documentation or records pertinent to the incident.

Please provide any records that are readily available at no cost. If the cost of fulfilling this request exceeds $20, please notify me before processing the records. As similar records have been previously produced for news organizations, the costs associated with providing these records should be minimal or waived. The records I am requesting pertain to incidents at Hard Rock Stadium on July 14th, 2024. Given that these records have already been released to media outlets, I expect that the retrieval and distribution of these documents will not incur significant expenses. Please ensure that any charges are clearly justified. Thank you for your cooperation and attention to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Samuel Newton

Dear National Park Service:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED:

I am seeking records related to NPS mascot Freddie the Flathead Catfish, the mascot of the Mississippi National River and Recreation Area.

Specifically, I request the following records:

1. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, and design of the Freddie the Flathead Catfish mascot. Please include any contracts or design concepts (e.g. sketches) in your production, as well as any records related to NPS's decision to create a mascot for the Mississippi National River and Recreation Area in the first place. 

2. Please produce all Freddie-related promotional items, educational items, or tchotchkes, past or present, that took the form of records, such as trading cards, posters, videos, worksheets, or books (including but not limited to coloring books, activity books, or comic books).

3. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, design, and use of any wearable Freddie costumes. Responsive records would include contracts for the design or production of such a costume; design proposals or sketches; correspondence with the designer or manufacturer; and any guidelines related to the use of or care for the costume.

4. Please produce all communications related to Freddie.

5. Please produce all photographs of Freddie. You may omit any photographs already posted to the agency’s Flickr page https://www.flickr.com/photos/134392837@N04/albums/.

6. Please produce all correspondence related to Freddie (or to mascots in general) sent to or from any member of Congress, their office, or their staff. Senator Joni Ernst (R-IA) may have sent some mascot-related correspondence around 2019.

7. Please produce all records related to any proposal or decision to stop using Freddie as part of NPS's public outreach.

REQUEST FOR FEE WAIVER:

The requested documents will be made available to the general public online for free, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am working on a project examining the history, creation, evolution, and use of mascots across the federal government—because, like many others, I find them fascinating and weirdly delightful. Thus, I respectfully request that any fees related to this request be waived. If you do decide to charge me fees, please notify me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION:

I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION:

Thank you very much for your cooperation with this request. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: AI disclosures
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

In October 2023, President Biden signed an executive order on the Safe, Secure, and Trustworthy Development and Use of Artificial Intelligence. Section 4.2(a) of this order requires that companies inform the federal government if they are "developing or demonstrating an intent to develop" AI models or computing clusters that exceed certain computing power thresholds.

I am requesting copies of information, reports, and records sent to the Commerce Department by companies pursuant to Section 4.2 of the Safe, Secure, and Trustworthy Development and Use of Artificial Intelligence. Specifically, I am requesting records sent by Amazon, Alphabet, Microsoft, OpenAI, Meta, Anthropic, and any other companies that have disclosed AI models or computing clusters pursuant to Section 4.2 between October 2023 and the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Aaron Holmes

Dear National Park Service:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED:

I am seeking records related to NPS mascot Sunny Saguaro, the mascot of Saguaro National Park.

Specifically, I request the following records:

1. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, and design of the Sunny Saguaro mascot. Please include any contracts or design concepts (e.g. sketches) in your production, as well as any records related to NPS's decision to create a mascot for Saguaro National Park in the first place. Community engagement coordinator Cam Juárez may have records responsive to this request.

2. Please produce all Sunny Saguaro-related promotional items, educational items, or tchotchkes, past or present, that took the form of records, such as trading cards, posters, videos, worksheets, or books (including but not limited to coloring books, activity books, or comic books).

3. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, design, and use of any wearable Sunny Saguaro costumes. Responsive records would include contracts for the design or production of such a costume; design proposals or sketches; correspondence with the designer or manufacturer; and any guidelines related to the use of or care for the costume.

4. Please produce all communications related to Sunny Saguaro.

5. Please produce all photographs of Sunny Saguaro.

6. Please produce all correspondence related to Sunny Saguaro (or to mascots in general) sent to or from any member of Congress, their office, or their staff. Senator Joni Ernst (R-IA) may have sent some mascot-related correspondence around 2019.

7. Please produce all records related to any proposal or decision to stop using Sunny Saguaro as part of NPS's public outreach.

REQUEST FOR FEE WAIVER:

The requested documents will be made available to the general public online for free, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am working on a project examining the history, creation, evolution, and use of mascots across the federal government—because, like many others, I find them fascinating and weirdly delightful. Thus, I respectfully request that any fees related to this request be waived. If you do decide to charge me fees, please notify me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION:

I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION:

Thank you very much for your cooperation with this request. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

title: Subject: Request for Information on Inmate Deaths in Custody (2018-2024)

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Subject: Request for Information on Inmate Deaths in Custody (2018-2024)
communications.communication:
Subject: Request for Information on Inmate Deaths in Custody (2018-2024)

Dear St. Louis County Jail - Buzz Westfall Justice Center,

 I am writing to formally request information regarding the names of inmates who have passed away while in custody at your facility from the years 2018 through 2024. This request is made in accordance with public records laws and aims to gather data for research purposes.

The information requested is intended to contribute to a broader understanding of inmate health and safety within correctional facilities. By analyzing the circumstances surrounding these unfortunate events, we aim to identify trends and potential areas for improvement in inmate care and management.

Specific Information Requested:

1. Names of Inmates: Please provide the full names of all inmates who have died while in custody during the specified timeframe.
2. Dates of Death: Along with the names, I would appreciate it if you could include the dates on which these deaths occurred.
3. Circumstances (if available): If possible, any additional details regarding the circumstances surrounding each death would be invaluable for our research.

I understand that certain information may be subject to privacy laws and regulations. Therefore, I assure you that any data provided will be handled with the utmost respect for confidentiality and used solely for research purposes.

Thank you very much for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Sheila Jackson Lee (January 12, 1950 – July 19, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee (January 12, 1950 – July 19, 2024). Her death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find a statement by Vice President Kamala Harris on her passing at the following link: https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2024/07/20/statement-from-vice-president-kamala-harris-on-the-passing-of-congresswoman-sheila-jackson-lee/

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman. ANSWERS to the Questionnaires

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Silly me I asked for the Questionnaires, I thought any idiot would realize I wanted the ANSWERS to the questionnaires, but you thought you'd be cute and redact the answers. Hope buying yourself three weeks was worth it.  Also, you know I don't drive so it would be nice if you'd do the answers in the NORMAL WAY and not put them on a thumb drive so you can have me trot on down there and you can see who brought me.  That's what this is, isn't it? Inconvenience and a few giggles, well, send me the answers to the questionnaires, and the other stuff you neglected to ad. Keep thinking everyone is stupid. Go ahead it's served you well so far, right?

Dustin, dear, you can go ahead and write me another little bitch out note about how this has nothing to do with Felton but we both know that at this point, it does. Plus, YOU are still an officer of the court. Tick tock.



We request all responsive ANSWERS  from the employees and any further correspondence from any supervisor to any employee or from supervisor to supervisor to the questionnaire's that we received in open records. We request all documentation that accompanied these questions and their answers and further request and disciplinary measures that generated from any questionnaires that have been handed out by ANY supervisor in the past 13 months. 

All letters of explanation from Aaron Burns, James Wolfe, Brad Stovall, Tim Davenport, Martin Arellano, Rose Peterson, Dustin Losak, Pete Peterson, Hunter Herring, Parnell McNamara, Jeremy Bost, Cody Blossman, Mike Gates, Colt Braziel, All Jail Sgt's. Any questionnaires that any of the employees have answered in the past 13 months, any letters 

We also request any and all disciplinary actions that have been issued since Cody Blossman has been Chief Deputy or in the past 13 months.  We would like to include all disciplinary records that are being kept in supervisors desk and not placed in the personnel files as these are government documents and we are requesting them. The fact that these disciplinary records may be being kept in a desk or file does not exempt them from being subject to open records as all disciplinary measures are open to the public to view.  

We request the names of all employees who have resigned or been terminated from the McLennan County Sheriffs Office since Cody Blossman has been chief deputy or in the past 13 months. 

We further request any and all emails and correspondence between Cody Blossman and Anna Picasso for the past 13 months.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell

Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. communications.subject: FOIL Request :: W012283-072024
communications.communication:
Chris Gelardi 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR169785 
Boston, MA 02115 
RE: Public Records Request for Police records 
Dear Chris Gelardi, 
I am in receipt of your Freedom of Information Law request, dated 7/20/2024.  Your request is being reviewed and could take up to 20 business days to be completed. 
Under NYS Law, you may be charged $.25 per page for photocopying (if applicable), or other fees allowed under the Public Officers Law.  See below fee schedule: 
$0.25 PER PAGE 
$10.00 PER CD, DVD USB 
PLEASE NOTE: Pursuant to POL Art 6 § 87(1)(c): In determining the actual cost of reproducing a record, an agency may include: 
i.an amount equal to the hourly salary attributed to the lowest paid agency employee who has the necessary skill required to prepare a copy of the requested record; 
ii.  the actual cost of the storage devices or media provided to the person making the request in complying with such request; 
iii.  the actual cost to the agency of engaging an outside professional service to prepare a copy of a record, but only when an agency’s information technology equipment is inadequate to prepare a copy, if such service is used to prepare the copy; and 
iv.  preparing a copy shall not include search time or administrative costs, and no fee shall be charged unless at least two hours of agency employee’s time is needed to prepare a copy of the record requested. A person requesting a record shall be informed of the estimated cost of preparing a copy of the record if more than two hours of an agency employee’s time is needed, or if an outside professional service would be retained to prepare a copy of the record. 
 
Respectfully yours, 
Maryanne McCutcheon 
Records Access Officer

communications.communication:
Dear Requester, 
  
 Your Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request dated Sunday, July 21, 2024 (Eastern Standard Time) was received by the City of Syracuse on Sunday, July 21, 2024 (Eastern Standard Time). The request is being reviewed. Access to the records, in whole or part, will be determined in accordance with Article 6 of the New York Public Officers Law. 
  
 I anticipate that our review will be completed on or about Thursday, September 26, 2024. Due to an unusually high volume of requests received by our office, including a large number of extremely large, complex requests please know that we will make every effort to complete your request in a reasonable time frame, however we appreciate your patience as we diligently work to provide accurate and thorough responses to all of the requests we have received. Do not hesitate to reach out to FOIL@syrgov.net with any questions. 
  
 Pursuant to FOIL, a fee of $.25 per page for photocopies not exceeding 9'x14' will be charged upon completion of the request, with the exception of electronic copies provided via e-mail. All other fees will be based on the material requested. 
  
 Thank you in advance for your cooperation. If you have any questions, or require further information, please do not hesitate to contact me.

title: PR100 Study Cost Breakdown (National Renewable Energy Laboratory)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: PR100 Study Cost Breakdown (National Renewable Energy Laboratory)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

According to the Department of Energy, "the Puerto Rico Grid Resilience and Transitions to 100% Renewable Energy Study (PR100)  is a 2-year study by the U.S. Department of Energy’s (DOE’s) Grid Deployment Office and six national laboratories to comprehensively analyze stakeholder-driven pathways to Puerto Rico’s clean energy future." The study concluded Puerto Rico could feasibly transition to a 100% renewable energy future by 2050.

Therefore, I request the following records: 

1) Documentation showing the budget and/or cost breakdown of the PR100 study. 

Keywords: "PR100" "Puerto Rico renewable" "budget" and "PR100 Budget"

This records request is for records between January 1, 2022 and the time this request is processed.

This record is not being made for commercial purposes. I am an independent journalist from Puerto Rico and any documents released from this request will be used in the course of reporting about energy policies and innovations in Puerto Rico for the newsletter Heavy Weather (heavyweather.ghost.io).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Department of Energy publications show the DOE awarded the Nuclear Alternative Project (NAP) a $1,628,285 grant  in 2021 to evaluate the "general site suitability for small modular reactors and microreactors in Puerto Rico. Results of the study will support DOEs mission to commercialize these technologies in small island and/or remote locations." This is the second grant NAP has been awarded by the DOE to study the viability of nuclear energy in Puerto Rico. (https://www.energy.gov/ne/articles/doe-awards-85-million-advance-promising-nuclear-technologies)

The first grant given to NAP by DOE was for $800,000 to make a similar nuclear suitability study in Puerto Rico. (https://www.paralanaturaleza.org/avanza-el-plan-para-instalar-energia-nuclear-en-puerto-rico/)

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) Communications, emails, messages, and attachments between the Department of Energy's Office of Nuclear Energy's U.S. Industry Opportunities and members of the NAP concerning the two grants given to NAP by the DOE. 

2) Documents, presentations, videos, or any such documentation of the approval process for giving the two grants to NAP. Specifically, documents that show the approval criteria for awarding the grant and how it was met by NAP's proposal.

3) Documents showing the budget and/or cost breakdown of how the grants by DOE were used to carry out the necessary activities to complete both nuclear viability studies in Puerto Rico. 

This records request is for records between January 1, 2019 and the time this request is processed.

Keywords: "Nuclear Alternative Project," "NAP," "Puerto Rico," and "nuclear"

This record is not being made for commercial purposes. I am an independent journalist from Puerto Rico and any documents released from this request will be used in the course of reporting about energy policies and innovations in Puerto Rico for the newsletter Heavy Weather (heavyweather.ghost.io).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NWLF 7.19.24
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

You are receiving this correspondence as a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. subsection 552. I am requesting the following:

Copies of all Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) records, documents, and communications responsive to the New World Liberation Front (NWLF). The NWLF was a radical left-wing terrorist group that formed on or around November 23, 1973, with the bombing of a Pacific Gas and Electric utility substation in Cupertino, California. Over the next six years, the NWLF was credited with bombings throughout the United States; one instance, in 1976, involved members of the organization placing an explosive device on a windowsill at the home of then-San Francisco Supervisor (and later United States Senator) Dianne Feinstein. NWLF membership overlapped with another organization the FBI monitored in this same period: the Symbionese Liberation Army (SLA). SLA members Bill and Emily Harris claimed membership in the NWLF at the time of their arrests, in 1975.

The FBI, at various points during the 1970s, identified the NWLF as a subject of interest in ongoing investigations. Page six of a memorandum located in the FBI's HEARNAP records (dated October 11, 1974; HEARNAP Part 21, page 41) contains what appears to be a Bureau file number for the NWLF at its Los Angeles Field Office: "LOS ANGELES IS CONDUCTING INVESTIGATION REGARDING THE CASE CAPTIONED 'UNSUB; BOMBING OF SHERATON AIRPORT HOTEL, 9750 AIRPORT BOULEVARD, LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA, OCTOBER 5, 1974' EID - NEW WORLD LIBERATION FRONT, 00: LOS ANGELES, LOS ANGELES FILE 174-2103."

Additionally, a September 7, 1978 bulletin created by the FBI Terrorism Research Center outlined a detailed history and methodology of the NWLF, stating, in part: "[I]ncidents, over 70,  have ... occurred in Seattle, Washington; Rainier, Oregon; and Aurora, Colorado. Victims of NWLF attacks have included Federal, state and local governmental functions, diplomatic establishments, corporate facilities, and public utilities. Communiques claiming responsibility for the incidents state the actions were staged to protest against governmental policies and the intervention of the U.S. corporations into the internal affairs of foreign countries."

Both items indicate that the FBI created HQ and field office files for the NWLF in the course of investigations into terrorist attacks carried out by the organization. Therefore, I am requesting copies of all FBI records, documents, and communications responsive to the New World Liberation Front, aka the NWLF.

I am asking you waive any fees associated with this request. I am a member of the news media. My bylines, which include Unicorn Riot, Covert Action Magazine, and the Geopolitical Economy Report, can be found in both print and electronic publications, and I am sending this request in coordination with Muckrock, an award-winning and nationally-recognized news organization. Please take note of the Office of Management and Budget guidelines published March 27, 1987 (52 FR 10012) that include electronic publications and other nontraditional publishers as representatives of the news media.

A fee waiver is appropriate in situations where "disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations and activities of the government, and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester,” 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(iii). This request would contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations and activities of government with regard to the FBI's handling of investigations into left-wing terrorism. The FBI has already made public records related to the kidnapping of Patricia Hearst in its HEARNAP collection. Contained in these records are numerous references to then NWLF, yet the FBI has not released any records on this group. Contemporaneous and postmortem accounts of the NWLF identify that Ms. Hearst interacted with NWLF members before her capture, thus the release of all NWLF records would contribute significantly to public understanding of the FBI's handling of the HEARNAP case.

Moreover, the NWLF carried out attacks on public officials and public services for almost a decade. Understanding how the FBI responded to these attacks is a matter of public interest.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. All documents will be provided to the general public without charge.

In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay up to $100. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I look forward to your response within 20 working days, as the statute requires. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Sincerely,

Robert Skvarla, Jr.

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fassistant-principals-military-academies-169727%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ6_n4zL9LUQrOAhSu0BQ7O8%3A1sV3hf%3A4nM1Kq-MFspq5wGjRSmmO7YY5GnpNiah7-ykP-fhnYk 
 
Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.
